text:
. View photo
Seclore's Enterprise Digital Rights Management Automatically Protects Content Downloaded and Shared from â€¦ MOUNTAIN VIEW, CA --(Marketwired - October 23, 2015) - Seclore, the leading provider of Enterprise Digital Rights Management (EDRM) solutions, today announced that Tejon Ranch Company ( TRC ) will be using Seclore FileSecure in conjunction with their IBM ECM solution, email, and file shares. 
Tejon Ranch Company, a diversified real estate and agribusiness company, uses IBM ECM to store sensitive files that need to be utilized in their business processes. Their business includes managing oil, gas and mineral reserves, developing master-planned residential communities and developing commerce centers. In the course of doing business, sensitive files including strategic plans, financial statements, and other intellectual property need to be shared with external business partners and advisors. Once they are downloaded from the IBM ECM system, they are typically shared via email, file-sharing services and are often accessed using mobile devices and personal laptops. 
"We realized that the files we were sharing could easily get into the hands of an unauthorized user when a device is stolen, by accident when an email is sent to the wrong person, or maliciously since the file could be readily copied and forwarded," stated Richard Daley, Director of Records and Information Management at Tejon Ranch. "We were looking for a way to extend the security we had internally to content that is shared outside of our perimeter. The Seclore FileSecure Connector for IBM ECM makes it easy for us to automatically add persistent, file-centric security to content that is downloaded from IBM ECM and shared during collaboration processes." 
Seclore FileSecure EDRM protects files wherever they go. Using FileSecure, organizations can control and audit exactly who can access a file, what they can do with the file, for how long, and from which device. These usage controls remain with the file and can be remotely modified or revoked by the document owner at any time.
With the IBM ECM Connector for Seclore FileSecure, organizations can automatically apply granular usage policies to content as it is downloaded and shared. The policies are persistent and will protect that content even after it has left the IBM ECM system, ensuring secure internal and external collaboration. Policies already defined in IBM ECM can be 'federated' and mapped to the usage policies that are used to persistently protect files to streamline the administration effort.
"We are really excited to have Tejon Ranch as a new user of Seclore FileSecure," stated Vishal Gupta, CEO at Seclore. "The combination of Seclore FileSecure and IBM ECM is providing Tejon Ranch with a seamless way to leverage and extend their investment in IBM ECM and ensure that all of their sensitive information can be securely shared."
About Seclore 
Seclore offers an innovative Enterprise Digital Rights Management solution, FileSecure, which enables organizations to control usage of files wherever they go, both within and outside of the organization's boundaries. The ability to remotely enforce and audit who can view, edit, copy, and re-distribute files empowers organizations to embrace mobility, file-sharing, and external collaboration with confidence. 
Easy to deploy and use, Seclore FileSecure extends the security of DLP, ECM, ERP, File Sharing and eMail solutions to protect information that move beyond the perimeter. Seclore was recently recognized by Frost & Sullivan with a 'Growth Excellence' award, Gartner as a 'Cool Vendor', and by Deloitte as one of the '50 Fastest Growing Technology Companies' due to innovations in agentless receipt of protected documents. With over 4 million users across 400 companies in 29 countries, Seclore is helping organizations achieve their data security, governance, and compliance objectives. 
Visit us at www.seclore.com for more information.
About Tejon Ranch Company: 
Tejon Ranch Company is a diversified real estate development and agribusiness organization. In addition to the 270,000-acre land holding 60 miles north of Los Angeles, Tejon Ranch Company's real estate developments include the world-class Tejon Ranch Commerce Center and an upscale retail outlet center. Tejon Ranch Company is also developing several master-planned residential communities including a mountain resort community known as Tejon Mountain Village; Centennial, a landmark new town in Los Angeles County; and Grapevine, a similar master-planned community in Kern County.
More information about Tejon Ranch Company can be found online at http://www.tejonranch.com
